title: The Collected Mr Magellan (1970s) (FRENCH+DUTCH) (~98% complete)
description:
OVERVIEW (English):  <a href=" http://www.coolfrenchcomics.com/mrmagellan.htm" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.coolfrenchcomics.com/mrmagellan.htm</a>   -   extract:

    " Mr. Magellan works for the International Testing Organization, testing
      a number of advanced technological devices. With his friend Capella, a
      super-strong antique collector, he thwarts the offbeat schemes of a
      variety of mad scientists. A recurring adversary is 'Casimir Boudu', a
      meek-looking old man who is in reality a peace-loving, blue-skinned
      alien whose mission is to slow down Earth's technological progress. " 

OVERVIEW (French):   <a href=" http://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mr_Magellan" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mr_Magellan</a>

OVERVIEW (Dutch):    <a href=" http://nl.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mr_Magellan" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://nl.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mr_Magellan</a>


CONTAINS:

   8 (out of 8) graphic novels and 38/29 (out of 39/30) short stories, for the
   French/Dutch versions, respectively. All of them were originally published in
   serialized format in "Journal Tintin"/"Kuifje weekblad" from 1969 thru 1979, and
   all of the long and most of the short stories were later re-printed in dedicated
   graphic albums. The French scans originate from the latter throughout, and are of
   consistently high quality. The Dutch scans originate mostly from the latter, too,
   however with a fair portion of the shorts filled in as direct extracts from
   "Kuifje" magazine; many of the scans unfortunately seem to be based on visibly
   aged and degraded copies - never to the point of illegibility, though. Contents
   are arranged by language first and by original publication order second
